TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Vector extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

summary.span: Represents a displacement in 2-D space.

span.span: Represents a displacement in 2-D space.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A表示的固定的位置，但代表方向和大小 （例如，速度或加速）。A represents a fixed position, but a represents a direction and a magnitude (for example, velocity or acceleration). 因此，直線線段的結束點是點，但其差異是向量;也就是說，方向和長度的行區段。Thus, the endpoints of a line segment are points but their difference is a vector; that is, the direction and length of that line segment. 在 XAML，之間的分隔符號並的值可以是逗號或空格。In XAML, the delimiter between the and values of a can be either a comma or a space. 某些文化特性可以使用逗號字元作為十進位分隔符號，而不是句號字元。Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character. XAML 處理而異的文化特性為 EN-US，在大部分的 XAML 處理器實作中，預設值，並預期為小數分隔符號的期間。XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter. 您應該避免使用逗號字元作為十進位分隔符號，如果指定在 XAML 中，因為會將衝突的字串類型轉換屬性值插入和元件。You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a attribute value into the and components. ## XAML Attribute UsageXAML Attribute Usage ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 標準化的向量會維護其方向，但其變成 1。A normalized vector maintains its direction but its becomes 1. 產生的向量通常稱為單位向量。The resulting vector is often called a unit vector. 向量標準化是除以其本身向量。A vector is normalized by dividing the vector by its own . ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用這個方法來標準化的向量。The following example shows how to use this method to normalize a vector. [!code-csharp[VectorExamples_snip#NormalizeExample_csharp](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/VectorExamples_snip/CSharp/VectorExample.cs#normalizeexample_csharp)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 向量並屬性的描述是使用值。A vector's and properties are described using values. 因為值它，比較兩個執行算術運算時可能會遺失有效位數邏輯上相等的結構可能會失敗。Because the value of a can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on it, a comparison between two structures that are logically equal might fail. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用這個運算子 （= =） 來檢查是否有兩個結構是否相等。The following example shows how to use this operator (==) to check whether two structures are equal.
